result.execSummary:
The defendant Jon R Couillard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court orders that if the defendant fails to pay the fine and costs within 60 days of the date of conviction or if the Court has authorized monthly payments for the fine and costs and they have not been paid, the Court will enter a judgment and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect this debt.  You must keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jon R Couillard in court.  Rachel Payne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE has paid restitution in full.  DE will enter a plea of NC.  Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  Court will accept plea and find the DE guilty.  Court will order CC.  Will pay within 60 days.

Defendant Jon R Couillard in court telephonic  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court informs DE he must be here in person for next court date.  DE states he contacted the DA for possible settlement today.  Set for review hearing 4-07-15 @ 3:30PM.  Quash warrant.
Defendant Jon R Couillard not in court.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court will order a Bench Warrant, $1500.00 cash bond, WI application only.
Review hearing on March 17, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
